Yes there are homeless people living on the boardwalk buts thats the nature of trhe business down there.... During the day they just blend in w/the crowds.... and at night I have never been bothered at all.... The beach does get quite and dark at night but thats b/c its the beach and theres not much else around except for lots of water! The staff is awesome.... tell you exact where to park on the street so walk the 2 blocks it's no big deal.... the bottle wine is a nice touch and the rooms are very nice.... you can just settle into your small apartment for a few days.... very relaxing.... def worth the rooms above the first floor so you get a view of the water/boardwalk....

Reviews.Title: “Great Location; Great Manager”
Reviews.Author: VaWingfoot
Reviews.Content: We were 3 groups of family members (aged 22 to 87 years old) and had 3 rooms here June 14-17, 2007. The beachfront location is great, but the hotel is very old, has a scary elevator and definitely needs sprucing up. The previous comment about the bathtubs and sinks was right on target. I stayed in Room 304 and had a great view looking south at the boardwalk/ocean, but you had to ignore all the ugly rooftops to see the view. Room 108 was large and had a more modern shower, but was inside the back door and had a lot of noise of people coming in and out the door. There was no view from this room. Room 207 was an OK size room with a ball-and-claw bathtub. It also had no view. They could improve this hotel significantly just by replacing the sheets, towels and bedspreads and adding a few coats of paint. Bigger bathroom sinks would also be a plus. The manager, Teri, was so friendly, informative and hospitable, that it was easy for us to ignore some of the hotel's shabbiness. Teri made our stay much more pleasant -- whatever her boss is paying her, he should triple it! All in all, we left feeling that, overall, it was a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and Cheerful”
Reviews.Author: everlovin
Reviews.Content: Dublin Ireland....I stayed here with my 4 yr old son for 4 nights based on tripadvisors reviews and Im glad I did.We didnt have a car and found we were able to travel very easily on public transport which is right by the hotel,sometimes not returning till late and we were never in fear or afraid who was around or the "dodgy" looking characters that live on the beach.The kitchenette is well stocked with dishes,fridge,stove top and microwave...enough to cook a meal if you so wished.The staff were very friendly and most helpful.It was great staying in a place where the first thing you dont hear is knocking on your door to have it cleaned or the noise of a vacume cleaner outside.I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants great value for money and a great location...I mean there arent many hotels where you step out the front door onto the boardwalk and a few steps further your on the beach.Hope to get back again soon

Reviews.Title: “Don't understand these reviews...”
Reviews.Author: NYorkers
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Venice Beach Suites for a few nights in March after reading these reviews. And while I usually find Tripadvisor to be completely accurate, I don't understand how this dingy place could get such great reviews. On the plus side: the management is truly very nice, and the location is right by the beach. But that's about it. Someone here mentioned how the building was recently renovated. We couldn't find a trace of that. The walls had the paint of the last 60 years stuck to them, the floors in the bathrooms were old and crusty (although cleaned by the staff, but that only helps so much), the tub in our room was ancient, the sinks are the size of a deck of cards, so water splashes everywhere when you wash. The dishes in the kitchen are clean, but the appliances are old and look beaten up. And not all rooms are equal, as we noticed when we peeked into someone else's. Some have nice views, it seems. It's not that things are dirty. The staff clearly cleans the place. But everything is so old and worn, every second it reminds you of the thousands of people who must have been there before you. Example: while our sheets were clean and smelled fresh, they had stains on them that hadn't some out. Of what, I can only guess. If it hadn't been for the very nice management (yes, they give you a bottle of wine when you check in and have a personal note waiting for you in your room), I would categorize this "hotel" as a very budget place. The location is also in a more dangerous part of Venice, for which the hotel cannot be faulted, but that's something to think about when booking. Don't walk around here at night. many homeless, many dark alleys. North Venice or Santa Monica offers a more relassuring atmosphere.
